name: nbstatus
short_description:
nbstatus is a shell script analyzing symantec netbackup utilization so you can easily improve your backup process.
By running nbstatus you exactly know how much data you backup within a period.

Edit nbstatus.sh first lines :
hours=800                 #800 = 33 days
dest1=XXX                 #ex : appliance or master server name
dest2=XXX                 #ex : appliance or master server name
supervision=XXX         #server receiving nbstatus logs
supervision_dest=XXX #directory

Then run ./nbstatus.sh

It will generate :
$(hostname)_${dest}_tot.log	total data written within the period
$(hostname)_${dest}_full.log	full backups information
$(hostname)_${dest}_vol.log		biggest backups
$(hostname)_${dest}_tps.log		longest backups
